100200-d-10-02-00-STE.Narrative: ON OCTOBER 2, 2000 ST&E CREW WENT TO PULL THE 23 RAILCARS SOUTH OF MINER AVE.  AFTER PERFORMING AN AIR BRAKE TEST THE ENGINEER STARTED PULLING THE CUT OF CARS, AT THAT POINT 15 OF THE RAILCARS PROCEEDED DOWN ST&E MAIN TRACK AND THE OTHER 8 RAILCARS THAT WERE SHOVED THROUGH THE UP SWITCH PROCEEDED DOWN AN ADJACENT TRACK OWNED BY THE UP RAILROAD, CAUSING THE SIXTEENTH AND SEVENTEENTH RAILCARS TO DERAIL, AND THE REMAINING 6 RAILCARS ON THE UP RAILROAD.  ON SEPTEMBER 29, 2000 AND SEPTEMBER 30, 2000,BNSF INTERCHANGED RAILCARS TO ST&E.  ST&E CREW WERE OFF ON SEPTEMBER 30TH AND OCTOBER 1ST.  CONCLUSION:  BNSF EMPLOYEES EITHER SHOVED WITHOUT A PERSON RIDING THE POINT WHILE SHOVING AROUND THE CURVETO PROTECT THE MOVEMENT, OR THEY FAILED TO REPORT THAT THEY HAD RAN THROUGH A SWITCH OF A FOREIGN RAILROAD.  IN EITHER CASE, IT'S A VIOLATION OF THE BNSF OPERATING RULES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

200050-d-10-24-00-TM.Primary Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
200050-d-10-24-00-TM.Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)
200050-d-10-24-00-TM.Narrative: TRACTOR TRUCK TOWING A TANKER TRAILER LOADED WITH 180 BARRELS OF PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL, A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL CLASS 3 FLAMABLE LIQUID WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON JENNINGS ROAD, AND FAILED TO STOP FOR AN APPROACHING TRAIN TRAVELING WEST ON THE MAIN LINE TRACKS.  THE TRAIN STRUCK THE TRUCK BEHIND THE CAB ANDDRAGGED IT APPROXIAMTELY 594 FEET.  A SHORT DISTANCE AFTER IMPACT, CRUDE OIL WAS SPILLED ON THE TRACK AND IGNITED BURNING OVER 525 FEET OF RAILROAD TIES AND TRACK.  WHEN THE WRECKAGE CAME TO A STOP, IT EXPLODED AND BURNED COMPLETELY THE TRUCK, TRAILER AND THE FIRST LOCOMOTIVE COMPLETELY.  THE TWO HELPER LOCOMOTIVES RECEIVED HEAVY FIRE AND SMOKE DAMAGE.  THE CAUSE OF THIS ACCIDENT WAS THE TRUCK DRIVER FAILED TO STOP AT A RAILROAD CROSSING WHILE TRANSPORTING A FLAMABLE LIQUID HAZARDOUS MATERIAL AND FOR FAILURE TO STOP FOR AN APPROACHING TRAIN.  NO EVACUATION WAS NECESSARY AS THIS OCCURRED IN A RURAL AREA.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

161374-d-10-08-00-SOO.Narrative: GLENDALE JOB ASSIGNMENT 4231 HAD 14 CARS (ONE LOAD, 13 EMPTIES, WHEN THEY DEPARTED GLENDALE  ENROUTETO MUSKEGO YARD.  TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AT STATE STREET BRIDGE,  WHEN THE LAST THREE CARS IN THE TRAIN WERE DERAILED AT THE BRIDGE, "ALL EMPTIES".   THE CARS DERAILED APPROXIMATELY 800 FT PRIOR IN A CURVE.   DUE TO CROSS ELEVATION PROBLEMS IN THIS CURVE,  A WHEEL CLIMBED RAIL TEN CAR LENGTHS SOUTH OF THIS CURVE AND CARS THEN ENCOUNTERED SWITCH THAT WAS OOS CAUSING TRUCKS TO HEAD TOWARDS WESTBOUND TRACK.   CARS THEN CONTINUED TO FOLLOW REST OF TRAIN WITHOUT GOING INTO EMERGENCY UNTIL CAR STRUCK BRIDGE.  THE TRAIN CREW DID NOT NOTICE OR FEEL THAT CARS WERE DERAILED, THERE WAS SMALL BALLASTSPREAD ON TOP OF TIES THAT HAD NOT BEEN TAMPED YET,  "MADE FOR A SMOOTH,LEVEL RIDE OVER TIES".  CURRENTLY THERE IS A 10 MPH TEMPORARY SLOW ORDER BETWEEN MILE POST 89.5 AND GRAND AVENUE DUE TO ENGINEERING TRACK PROJECT.  LOCOMOTIVE SOO 4404 WAS DOWNLOADED AT SCENE AND WAS REVIEWED WITH NO EXCEPTIONSTAKEN.  WHEN TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY SPEED WAS 7.9 MPH. TRAIN WAS BELOW 10 MPH THROUGHOUT RESTRICTION AS WELL.  TRACK DAMAGE MINIMAL, BRIDGE DAMAGE MINIMAL, HOWEVER REQUESTED INSPECTION.  PETTIBONETO RERAIL IN MORNING,  ARRANGEMENTS WERE MADE WITH ENGINEERING TO HAVE WESTBOUND SWITCH PUT BACK INSERVICE SO THAT ACCESS WAS AVAILABLE TO GLENDALE WHILE RERAILING IS UNDERWAY.  DERAILED CARS: SOO  122597  HOPPER   EMPTY  ALL WHEELS   MINIMAL SOO  113758  HOPPER   EMPTY  ALL WHEELS   SI
